Class Button

java.lang.Object
  greenfoot.Actor
      GUIComponent
          Button

public class Button
extends GUIComponent

An implementation of a generic button for a game or application. The button is displayed using either supplied images or images generated automatically from text.

Button objects have two ways to respond to button clicks:

  1. Poll the state of a button using isPressed().
  2. Using the ActionListener interface.
The ActionListener interface is like the ActionListener interface in Java Swing. Scenarios using the ActionListener callback must include the ActionListener interface, and the class listening for button clicks must implement that interface. In addition, the implementing class must add itself to the callback list by calling the addActionListener() method. Then when a button of this class is clicked, the actionPerformed() method in the listening class will be called.

Note that you can make buttons with transparent backgrounds by using transparent background images or by setting the background to a transparent color. For example: 

button.setBackground(new Color(0, 0, 0, 0));

Version:
1.1 12/25/2010
Author:
Edward Parrish

Button

public Button()
Creates a button with no set text or image.

Button

public Button(greenfoot.GreenfootImage normalBG,
              greenfoot.GreenfootImage pressedBG,
              greenfoot.GreenfootImage hoverBG)
Creates a button using the specified images. The images may be written on with setText().

Parameters:
normalBG - The image displayed when the button is up (normal).
pressedBG - The image displayed when the button is down (pressed).
hoverBG - The image displayed when the mouse is hovering over the button.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when an image is null.

paintComponent

public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
Prepares the button's background images. If the images are supplied by the user, then copies those images onto the background. Otherwise, fills the background images with their respective colors.

Overrides:
paintComponent in class GUIComponent
Parameters:
g - The Graphics context in which to paint.
